trans-unit.source: Using the Import/Export Service REST API
trans-unit.target: Using the Import/Export Service REST API

trans-unit.source: Using the Azure Import/Export Service REST API
trans-unit.target: Using the Azure Import/Export Service REST API

trans-unit.source: The Microsoft Azure Import/Export Service exposes a REST API to enable programmatic control of import/export jobs.
trans-unit.target: The Microsoft Azure Import/Export Service exposes a REST API to enable programmatic control of import/export jobs.

trans-unit.source: You can use the REST API to perform all of the import/export operations that you can perform with the <externalLink><linkText>Azure Management Portal</linkText><linkUri>http://www.windowsazure.com/</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: You can use the REST API to perform all of the import/export operations that you can perform with the <externalLink><linkText>Azure Management Portal</linkText><linkUri>http://www.windowsazure.com/</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: Additionally, you can use the REST API to perform certain granular operations, such as querying the percentage completion of a job, which are not currently available in the Management Portal.
trans-unit.target: Additionally, you can use the REST API to perform certain granular operations, such as querying the percentage completion of a job, which are not currently available in the Management Portal.

trans-unit.source: See <externalLink><linkText>Using the Microsoft Azure Import/Export Service to Transfer Data to Blob Storage</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=329852%%amp;amp;clcid=0x409</linkUri></externalLink> for an overview of the Import/Export service and a tutorial that demonstrates how to use the Management Portal to create and manage import and export jobs.
trans-unit.target: See <externalLink><linkText>Using the Microsoft Azure Import/Export Service to Transfer Data to Blob Storage</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=329852%%amp;amp;clcid=0x409</linkUri></externalLink> for an overview of the Import/Export service and a tutorial that demonstrates how to use the Management Portal to create and manage import and export jobs.

trans-unit.source: The Azure Import/Export service provides a set of REST APIs at the following HTTPS endpoint for communicating between a client and the service.
trans-unit.target: The Azure Import/Export service provides a set of REST APIs at the following HTTPS endpoint for communicating between a client and the service.

trans-unit.source: Note that <codeInline>%%amp;lt;subscription-id%%amp;gt;</codeInline> is your subscription ID, available in the Azure Management Portal:
trans-unit.target: Note that <codeInline>%%amp;lt;subscription-id%%amp;gt;</codeInline> is your subscription ID, available in the Azure Management Portal:

trans-unit.source: To protect the security of customers’ data, the service endpoint is exposed only via HTTPS, not via HTTP, and anonymous requests are not allowed.
trans-unit.target: To protect the security of customers’ data, the service endpoint is exposed only via HTTPS, not via HTTP, and anonymous requests are not allowed.

trans-unit.source: The Import/Export service is a Microsoft Azure service and uses the Azure Service Management authentication scheme.
trans-unit.target: The Import/Export service is a Microsoft Azure service and uses the Azure Service Management authentication scheme.

trans-unit.source: See <link xlink:href="1becb7dc-1cdc-4db4-8ae8-7e351c96c251" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Authenticating Service Management Requests</link> for details on how to authenticate requests.
trans-unit.target: See <link xlink:href="1becb7dc-1cdc-4db4-8ae8-7e351c96c251" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Authenticating Service Management Requests</link> for details on how to authenticate requests.

trans-unit.source: Requests to the Import/Export service must conform to the versioning guidelines described in <link xlink:href="bb009293-529c-4793-b925-0f8701f337d2" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Service Management Versioning</link>.
trans-unit.target: Requests to the Import/Export service must conform to the versioning guidelines described in <link xlink:href="bb009293-529c-4793-b925-0f8701f337d2" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Service Management Versioning</link>.

trans-unit.source: All requests must specify the <parameterReference>x-ms-version</parameterReference> header and set its value to <languageKeyword>2014-05-01</languageKeyword>or <languageKeyword>2014-11-01</languageKeyword>.
trans-unit.target: All requests must specify the <parameterReference>x-ms-version</parameterReference> header and set its value to <languageKeyword>2014-05-01</languageKeyword>or <languageKeyword>2014-11-01</languageKeyword>.
